benchmark_details.name: Multilingual Hallucination Removal (MHR)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a two-stage Multilingual Hallucination Removal framework to mitigate hallucination in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs), specifically targeting both high-resource and low-resource languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the performance of LVLMs by mitigating multilingual hallucinations.
audience: Researchers in AI and machine learning
tasks: Evaluating model performance on multilingual datasets

data.source: POPE benchmark datasets, MME benchmark datasets

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated on extended benchmark evaluations
methodology.interpretation: Improvements in model accuracy for hallucination response handling
methodology.baseline_results: Average improvement of 19.0% on the POPE benchmark across 13 languages
methodology.validation: Experimental results demonstrated significant improvements in reducing hallucinations

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for model misuse leading to misinformation or data privacy issues

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data used is anonymized and follows ethical guidelines.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The datasets used are compliant with applicable data usage rights.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All data is collected in accordance with consent procedures.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The framework adheres to relevant legal and data protection regulations.
